pullRequest.title: [JENKINS-58223] Add directive generator for KubernetesDeclarativeAgent
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fix inline helps
Upstream PRs

 jenkinsci/workflow-cps-plugin#362
 jenkinsci/pipeline-model-definition-plugin#396

commit.message:
[JENKINS-58223] Add configuration UI for KubernetesDeclarativeAgent

Fix inline helps
Add back docker-workflow since it we need it for tests
Cloud being deleted shouldn't trigger a warning

nodes.bodyText:

@@ -114,9 +115,17 @@
       <version>${pipeline-model-definition.version}</version>
       <optional>true</optional>
     </dependency>
+    <dependency> <!-- DeclarativeGeneratorTester -->
+      <groupId>org.jenkinsci.plugins</groupId>
+      <artifactId>pipeline-model-definition</artifactId>
+      <version>${pipeline-model-definition.version}</version>
+      <classifier>tests</classifier>
+      <optional>true</optional>

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                Service account and Node selector when are overridden completely substitute any possible value found on the 'parent'.
          
          
            
                Service account and Node selector, when overridden, completely replace any value found on the “parent”.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@ +

+ A podTemplate may or may not inherit from an existing template.
+ This means that the podTemplate will inherit node selector, service account, image pull secrets, containerTemplates and volumes from the template it inherits from. +

+

+ Service account and Node selector when are overridden completely substitute any possible value found on the 'parent'.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change Namespace where to schedule the pod.
Namespace in which to schedule the pod.
nodes.diffHunk: @@ -0,0 +1,3 @@ +Namespace where to schedule the pod.

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change When ticked, the actual pod definition in yaml will be dumped in the build console (secrets redacted).
When checked, the actual pod definition in YAML will be dumped in the build console (secrets redacted).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,5 @@ +

+ When ticked, the actual pod definition in yaml will be dumped in the build console (secrets redacted).

nodes.bodyText: Suggested change If you want more fine-grained control, use the raw yaml field. If you want more fine-grained control, use the raw YAML field.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,4 @@ +

+ Volumes get mounted in all containers with the specified mount path.
+ If you want more fine-grained control, use the raw yaml field.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,50 @@
+<?jelly escape-by-default='true'?>
+<j:jelly xmlns:j="jelly:core" xmlns:f="/lib/form">
+  <f:entry field="cloud" title="${%Cloud to use}">
+    <f:select/>
+  </f:entry>
+  <f:entry field="namespace" title="${%Namespace}">
+    <f:textbox/>
+  </f:entry>
+  <f:entry field="inheritFrom" title="${%Pod template to inherit from}">
+    <f:select/>
+  </f:entry>
+
+  <f:entry field="yaml" title="${%Raw yaml for the Pod}">

nodes.bodyText:
Not really a unit test if using JenkinsRule.
Would @ClassRule be appropriate?

commit.message:
tests jar should be test scoped.

Co-authored-by: Jesse Glick <jglick@cloudbees.com>

Apply suggestions from @jglick

Co-authored-by: Jesse Glick <jglick@cloudbees.com>
Can use ClassRule for JenkinsRule in this class

Use em dash suggested by @jglick

Co-authored-by: Jesse Glick <jglick@cloudbees.com>
